sets.name: Imposter
sets.description: Thanks to Light Ball, Pikachu is a niche Imposter user that can break past less-sturdy Imposter-proofers, although it forgoes defensive utility in exchange. When Pikachu transforms, only the ability, item, and HP EVs listed here matter. The listed moves, non-HP EVs, and nature will very rarely see use: since Pikachu outspeeds all other Imposter users like Chansey, it is extremely rare that Pikachu is not transformed. Nevertheless, Volt Switch provides a reasonably strong pivoting option against opposing transformed Imposter users, which cause Pikachu's Imposter to fail, while Glare can paralyze threats to aid Pikachu later on. Healing Wish and Spikes both provide some utility if Pikachu is no longer needed. Since Pikachu is extremely frail, it can easily fall to any strong move from opposing threats it wants to transform into. Therefore, significant team support is needed to realize its potential. Paralysis spam through Nuzzle and Glare ensures Pikachu always outspeeds opposing threats like Mega Mewtwo X, and it can also generate free turns. Knock Off invalidates Pikachu, so Knock Off absorbers, such as Arceus with a held Plate are recommended. Bulky special walls like Ice Scales Arceus-Ground and Ho-Oh check Mega Diancie and Arceus-Ghost, which Pikachu cannot safely transform into: the former can OHKO with Extreme Speed, and the latter Imposter-proofs itself.

sets.name: Ice Scales
sets.description: With Eviolite and Ice Scales, Chansey becomes the bulkiest specially defensive wall in the tier, capable of walling virtually every special attacker. Ruination bypasses Chansey's meager offenses to deal damage. Toxic cripples bulky Pokemon like Arceus formes and setup sweepers like Palkia-O. Parting Shot allows Chansey to safely pivot teammates in thanks to its low Speed. Chanseyâ€™s low Attack limits Strength Sap healing from common special attackers, making it effective at wearing them down in the long run. Chansey's poor Defense means that it enjoys Fur Coat teammates like Groudon, Eternatus, and Arceus formes to check powerful physical attackers like Koraidon and Groudon. Chansey is also hindered by poison from Mortal Spin and Toxic, so having Hell Bell somewhere on the team is useful. Tera Ghost protects Chansey from being trapped, whereas Tera Poison makes it immune to poison and grants a resistance to Pixilate Extreme Speed from Arceus-Fairy.

sets.name: Magic Guard
sets.description: Mega Mewtwo X is a very strong mixed wallbreaker. With Magic Guard, Mega Mewtwo X can use powerful Life Orb-boosted attacks while ignoring the recoil that normally comes with these moves. Lumina Crash allows Mega Mewtwo X to pressure Ice Scales users that don't mind High Jump Kick, like Arceus-Fairy and Ho-Oh, eventually forcing them out through consecutive Special Defense drops. Astral Barrage allows Mega Mewtwo X to beat opposing Ghost-types like Lunala and Giratina more easily. Alternatively, Chloroblast provides Mega Mewtwo X with a way to beat Fur Coat users that can switch into High Jump Kick, like Groudon, Mega Slowbro, and Dondozo. Strength Sap, combined with Magic Guard, gives Mega Mewtwo X good staying power, allowing it to heal from chip damage that accumulates throughout a game. Chloroblast can also be used over Strength Sap, which trades longevity for greater coverage. Mega Mewtwo X appreciates Knock Off support from teammates to remove Covert Cloak from opposing special walls like Ho-Oh and Arceus formes, making them vulnerable to Lumina Crash. Mega Mewtwo X is weak to Extreme Speed from the likes of Pixilate Mega Diancie and Aerilate Rayquaza, so it appreciates teammates that can switch into these moves, such as Arceus-Poison and Mega Steelix. Magic Guard Mega Mewtwo X can be Imposter-proofed by Fur Coat Yveltal, Ice Scales + Covert Cloak Arceus-Fairy, and Fur Coat + Covert Cloak Miraidon.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Choice Band Mega Mewtwo X is a dangerous wallbreaker thanks to its huge Attack and sufficient Speed to outrun the most common physical walls. Mold Breaker lets Mega Mewtwo X break past Fur Coat walls more easily, notably ensuring that Close Combat 2HKOes Fur Coat Dondozo and non-resistant Arceus formes, while Sword of Ruin offers higher damage on non-Fur Coat Pokemon, hitting benchmarks like OHKOing Primal Kyogre and non-Fur Coat Yveltal. Wicked Blow dispatches Arceus-Ghost and Mega Slowbro, and it's Mega Mewtwo X's most best option into foes that resist Fighting and aren't weak to Steel, like Arceus-Poison and Imposter users. Gigaton Hammer removes Fairy-types like Arceus-Fairy and Mega Altaria. U-turn maintains momentum against switch-ins and helps rack up chip damage. Mega Mewtwo X's biggest nemesis is Fur Coat Arceus-Poison, which can stomach even a Mold Breaker Wicked Blow and heal off the damage; it can even potentially PP stall Mega Mewtwo X if it has Strength Sap. As such, allies that can threaten it, like Mega Garchomp, prove useful. Mega Mewtwo X also appreciates slow pivoting support from allies like Primal Kyogre and Mega Steelix to get it in safe from utility moves. Imposter-proof Mega Mewtwo X with Fur Coat users that aren't weak to its attacks, like Arceus-Poison and Dondozo.

sets.name: RegenVest
sets.description: RegenVest Primal Kyogre is an effective specially defensive pivot that is able to blanket check special attackers such as Mega Diancie, Eternatus, and Palkia-O. U-turn is not boosted by STAB but cannot be blocked by Desolate Land. Coming from Primal Kyogre's high Special Attack, Scald does respectable damage against neutral targets and greatly threatens Pokemon like Mega Diancie and Mega Steelix; the threat of burn also deters physical wallbreakers like Mega Mewtwo X from switching in. If Scald burns are undesirable because they conflict with other status conditions, Origin Pulse is a strong alternative. Knock Off removes key items like Covert Cloak, Assault Vest, and Imposter Chansey's Eviolite, allowing Primal Kyogre to status foes and assisting offensive teammates like Lumina Crash users. Mortal Spin is useful to force chip damage on Imposter users and threats like Palkia-O, and it also benefits from most Steel-types fearing Scald, preventing them from spinblocking. Nuzzle is an alternative that is more effective into offensive threats like Magic Guard Mega Mewtwo X and Ho-Oh but is noticeably worse into defensive Pokemon. Stone Axe doesn't conflict with Scald and is easier to Imposter-proof, but it makes Primal Kyogre almost helpless against threats like Palkia-O and Arceus-Fire, meaning reliable checks to these like Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy and Fur Coat Miraidon are needed. Primal Kyogre is threatened by powerful physical wallbreakers like Mewtwo Mega X; thus, physical walls such as Fur Coat Miraidon, Yveltal, and Arceus-Poison are good teammates. Special attackers like Mega Diancie, Mega Gardevoir, and Mega Alakazam appreciate Primal Kyogre removing key items like Assault Vest and Covert Cloak from special walls like Arceus-Fairy and opposing Primal Kyogre, and they can also be Imposter-proofed by Primal Kyogre. Primal Kyogre can be tricky to Imposter-proof; depending on the moveset, some decent options are Ice Scales Dialga-O and Jungle Healing users. Teammates such as Kartana also can offensively Imposter-proof Primal Kyogre by threatening an OHKO on Imposter users.

sets.name: Ice Scales
sets.description: Primal Kyogre is a premier special wall thanks to its great defensive typing and high special bulk, walling common threats such as Choice Specs Mega Diancie, Calm Mind Arceus formes, and Simple + No Retreat users. Scald's high PP and burn chance consistently allow it to scare off Mega Mewtwo X looking to switch-in and force it out, and it mortally threatens Blacephalon and Mega Diancie. Haze slows down setup sweepers such as Eternatus and Palkia-O, as well as Simple + No Retreat users like Arceus-Ghost. Flip Turn lets frail teammates such as Blacephalon, Mega Diancie, and Mega Beedrill switch in safely. Covert Cloak helps Primal Kyogre against Lumina Crash from users such as Mega Alakazam, Scald from opposing Primal Kyogre, Triple Arrows from Arceus-Ghost, and Mortal Spin from Arceus formes. Ice Scales Primal Kyogre is used on teams that require a special wall against Pokemon like Mega Alakazam, Choice Specs Mega Diancie, and Arceus-Ghost. However, Primal Kyogre loses to Mixed Mega Diancie, so physical walls such as Fur Coat Mega Swampert and Arceus-Poison are very valuable to beat Pokemon such as offensive Miraidon and mixed Mega Diancie. Despite Primal Kyogre Imposter-proofing itself thanks to Covert Cloak, it can't do much against Imposter, so allies like Choice Band Kartana and Desolate Land Ho-Oh are useful to help force out Imposter users. Entry hazard setters that don't mind burns from Scald, such as Fur Coat Lunala and Prankster Celesteela, as well as Knock Off users like Covert Cloak Arceus-Dark and Arceus-Water, can force Imposter to pivot out.

sets.name: Setup Attacker
sets.description: Groudon's base stats and STAB on Precipice Blades make it a premier choice for a bulky attacker. Fur Coat allows Groudon to wall many common threats, such as Koraidon and opposing Groudon, while Mold Breaker ignores Fur Coat and Levitate on walls like Eternatus, Arceus-Ghost, and Zamazenta-C. Victory Dance lets it reliably set up on opposing physical attackers like Groudon and Koraidon, whereas Tidy Up removes entry hazards and makes it harder for Imposter users to safely switch in thanks to the lack of a Defense boost. Toxic heavily cripples Precipice Blades switch-ins like Arceus formes and Dondozo, and it works especially well with Mold Breaker, which lets Groudon bait and punish Prankster users. Alternatively, Knock Off removes Heavy-Duty Boots, Leftovers, and Ability Shield from bulkier targets like Dondozo, Eternatus, and opposing Groudon. Earth Plate boosts Precipice Blades's damage, whereas Heavy-Duty Boots leaves Groudon less susceptible to chip damage from Spikes, and Rocky Helmet provides extra security against Population Bomb users like Ursaluna. Groudon's best fit is on balance and offense teams that want to compress a bulky attacker, non-passive wall, and possibly an entry hazard remover into a single teamslot. Teammates like Dondozo and Eternatus are recommended to shore up Groudon's weakness to Palafin-H, with the latter also helping out against Solar Beam Arceus-Fire. Use Corviknight to Imposter-proof Toxic and Mold Breaker Groudon variants, and a Fur Coat user that doesn't mind Knock Off for other variants.

sets.name: Aerilate
sets.description: Rayquaza is a dangerous mixed attacker with very few consistent long-term answers. Tera Flying Boomburst deals absurd damage, OHKOing everything that isn't a special wall or Flying-resistant target and 2HKOing many resistant foes like Corviknight and Dialga-O, provided the latter's Assault Vest has been removed. Extreme Speed helps chase out opposing offensive threats like Flutter Mane and Koraidon; Tera Flying Extreme Speed also 2HKOes Arceus and Zacian. Both coverage moves nuke Steel-types; Collision Course beats Chansey and is easier to Imposter-proof, while Headlong Rush beats Arceus-Electric and Zacian-C and makes offensive Imposter-proofing easier thanks to lowered defenses. Strength Sap helps offset Life Orb recoil and takes advantage of the switches Rayquaza forces, while Jungle Healing allows it to completely nullify Toxic Groudon at the cost of lower healing per use. Rash is used to maximize damage output, while Naive allows Rayquaza to outrun Jolly Groudon and most opposing Rayquaza. Rayquaza offers basically no defensive utility and hates taking status or Knock Off, meaning slow pivoting support from Dondozo and RegenVest users like Dialga-O is mandatory. Entry hazard setters like Zacian and RegenVest users are recommended, as hazards help remove Rayquaza's need to predict and allow it to safely spam Boomburst. Imposter-proof Rayquaza with Ice Scales Arceus formes, Soundproof users, or Zacian-C.

sets.name: RegenVest
sets.description: RegenVest Dialga-O is a reliable specially defensive pivot. Revelation Dance lets it reliably threaten Arceus-Fairy and invalidates Normalize Flutter Mane, whereas Draco Meteor can OHKO Palkia-O. Nuzzle spreads paralysis and discourages faster threats like Zamazenta-C from switching in. U-turn allows Dialga-O to safely bring in teammates thanks to its low Speed. Stone Axe's Stealth Rock help make offensive threats more dangerous; alternatively, Knock Off removes items like Heavy-Duty Boots, Covert Cloak, and Imposter Chansey's Eviolite. Dialga-O's best fit is on balance teams that appreciate a non-passive slow pivot and a reliable source of paralysis. Offensive threats like Groudon, Flutter Mane, and Palkia-O are recommended to take maximum advantage of Dialga-O's slow U-turn; Dialga-O can also Imposter-proof the latter two. Imposter-proofing Dialga-O is normally done with a bulky Covert Cloak user like Arceus-Water or Groudon. Tera Fairy grants a Dragon immunity and makes Revelation Dance Fairy-type, improving Dialga-O's matchup against Koraidon and Palkia-O.

sets.name: Ice Scales
sets.description: Ice Scales Dialga-O is a robust special wall that can tank hits from most of the special attackers in the tier. Draco Meteor OHKOes the two most common special attackers in Palkia-O and Eternatus, and it also prevents specially-frail targets like Dondozo and Groudon from switching in safely. Toxic annoys bulky defensive Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Arceus formes, notably invalidating most setup variants of the latter, and it also prevents Fairy-types like Zacian from switching in freely. Parting Shot lets Dialga-O safely pivot in offensive teammates and can be cycled alongside a Prankster user to safely rack up Toxic damage; alternatively, Teleport allows Dialga-O to use 252 Speed EVs and moves after Ting-Lu's U-turn, which helps get dangerous wallbreakers like Koraidon and Enamorus in safe from utility moves like Knock Off and Nuzzle. Moonlight and Recover are largely the same, though Moonlight benefits from sun, whereas Recover is more consistent. Ice Scales Dialga-O's best fit is on balance teams that want a reliable, non-passive special wall and a slow pivot. Fairy-types like Zacian are recommended as backup checks for Tera Dragon + Dragon Energy attackers like Palkia-O, which can break past Dialga-O after Nasty Plot. Teammates like Primordial Sea Corviknight and Fur Coat Arceus-Fire are recommended to shore up Dialga-O's weakness to Pixilate Enamorus, which can threaten to 2HKO it with V-create or Headlong Rush. Tera Fairy grants a Dragon immunity and drops the Ground weakness, allowing Dialga-O to check Arceus-Ground, Palkia-O, and Enamorus in a pinch, even though it must watch out for the former's Toxic. Dialga-O Imposter-proofs itself thanks to its Toxic immunity, but it can be hard to prevent the foe from healing; pivoting to an offensive teammate like Choice Band Groudon or Koraidon is recommended to take advantage of this.

sets.name: Nasty Plot Sweeper
sets.description: Nasty Plot Palkia-O is a terrifying sweeper thanks to its brutally powerful STAB combination and good Speed. A Timid nature guarantees that Palkia-O outspeeds and threatens to OHKO almost all Arceus. Steam Eruption provides more consistent damage output and a potential burn, while Water Spout has potentially higher damage, won't miss, and can OHKO Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy after Nasty Plot and Spikes. Strength Sap is necessary to keep Dragon Energy and Water Spout's damage high as well as to allow Palkia-O greater freedom to switch in. Tera Dragon allows Dragon Energy to OHKO Dondozo and +4 Dragon Energy to OHKO Ice Scales Dialga-O, while Tera Water lets Palkia-O withstand Fairy-type attacks from users like Arceus-Fairy and Zacian. Palkia-O's best fit is on offense teams that can maximize the opportunities it gets and can easily pressure faster threats like Koraidon. Prankster and Ice Scales Chansey are complete counters for Palkia-O, as they are never threatened by its attacks and make Strength Sap worthless; as such, mixed attacking teammates like Enamorus and Triple Arrows Arceus-Ghost are highly recommended. Imposter-proof Palkia-O with a Desolate Land Arceus-Fairy or Ice Scales Chansey.

sets.name: Prankster
sets.description: Prankster + Haze Giratina's huge bulk and recovery and disruption options allow it to function as a reliable answer to setup users. Giratina has a wide array of options it can use to disrupt foes attempting to set up: Glare paralyzes fast attackers such as Palkia-O, Encore keeps them locked into moves such as Nasty Plot, Parting Shot lets Giratina pivot and Destiny Bond trades a KO, and Entrainment helps force out ability-dependent attackers. Heavy-Duty Boots helps Giratina switch in more easily without fear of entry hazard chip, while Covert Cloak helps prevent status from moves like Mortal Spin and Nuzzle. Tera Fairy improves Giratina's matchup into opposing Dragon-types such as Koraidon while maintaining a Fighting-type resistance, whereas Tera Dark grants immunity to status moves from opposing Prankster users and a Ghost- and Dark-type resistance for Flutter Mane and Arceus-Dark. Great partners for Prankster Giratina include RegenVest Ting-Lu, Fur Coat Dondozo, and Imposter users thanks to their strong defensive synergy, which allows Giratina to get in more comfortably against Arceus-Ghost and Koraidon.

sets.name: Magic Bounce
sets.description: Giratina is a great defensive Pokemon that provides utility and disruption with its immunity to Fighting and resistance to powerful attacks like V-create and Rising Voltage. Court Change makes Giratina effective at removing entry hazards against Mold Breaker entry hazard setters and Stone Axe Pokemon. Strength Sap helps with keeping strong physical attackers such as Groudon in check. Whirlwind bypasses Substitute to force out foes, whereas Encore can be used as another form of disruption. Scald is useful for spreading burns, especially against physical attackers such as Groudon and Zamazenta-C. Tera Fairy is great for the immunity to Dragon-type attacks from Koraidon, Eternatus, and Palkia-O, while Tera Dark is great for being resistant to Ghost- and Dark-type attacks from Arceus-Ghost and Hoopa-Unbound. Covert Cloak helps Giratina beat Imposter users and blocks troublesome status from Scald and Mortal Spin. Dondozo and RegenVest Ting-Lu are great partners for Giratina thanks to their physical bulk and complementary typings, which help Giratina against threats such as Eternatus and Arceus-Ghost.

sets.name: Pixilate
sets.description: Pixilate Arceus-Fairy is a solid wallbreaker that also reliably removes entry hazards with Boomburst and unblockable Rapid Spin, respectively. Extreme Speed provides a strong priority option against opposing attackers like Koraidon and Palkia-O; alternatively, Nuzzle lets Arceus-Fairy cripple Palkia-O, Imposter users, and defensive checks, and a pivoting move like Volt Switch or Flip Turn is also an option to retain momentum. Heavy-Duty Boots increases Arceus-Fairy's longevity and further improves its entry hazard removal potential, while Covert Cloak protects Arceus-Fairy from common moves with secondary effects, such as Nuzzle and Mortal Spin. Pixie Plate is another alternative to provide more immediate power, notably allowing Tera Fairy Arceus-Fairy to potentially OHKO Palkia-O, and also is immune to Knock Off. Wallbreakers such as Enamorus and Koraidon appreciate Arceus-Fairy removing entry hazards, threatening opposing sweepers, and pressuring common walls like Dondozo and Ting-Lu. Tera Fairy further boosts Arceus-Fairy's damage output, whereas Tera Steel provides a wide array of useful resistances, allowing Arceus-Fairy to pick off threats like Dialga-O.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Arceus-Fire's great defensive typing and base stats make it a solid Fur Coat wall. Lava Plume's burn heavily cripples common physical attackers like Koraidon and Groudon and forces chip damage on opponents. Heal Bell allows Arceus-Fire to support its teammates by removing status conditions like paralysis, burn, and poison. U-turn allows Arceus-Fire to safely bring in offensive teammates to exploit passive Lava Plume switch-ins, such as Dondozo and Giratina; alternatively, Knock Off allows Arceus-Fire to remove items like Covert Cloak and Heavy-Duty Boots, as well as an Imposter user's Eviolite. Arceus-Fire best fits on balance teams that appreciate a reliable check to V-create users and a bulky pivot. Teammates like Palkia-O and Koraidon appreciate Arceus-Fire's pivoting and ability to bring in and force damage on passive walls. Imposter-proofing can be done with any Pokemon immune to burn, such as a Covert Cloak user. Tera Flying gives Arceus-Fire an immunity to Ground-type attacks from Groudon and Ursaluna, on top of gaining a Spikes immunity.

sets.name: Desolate Land
sets.description: Arceus-Fire's Desolate Land-boosted V-create is a brutally strong attack, letting it force out most Pokemon by threatening an OHKO. Arceus-Fire's niche over other V-create users is its powerful Solar Beam, which removes common physical walls such as Dondozo and Groudon. Growth enables Arceus-Fire to set up on passive walls, whereas Glacial Lance targets Dragon-types such as Eternatus and Giratina. Life Orb increases Arceus-Fire's power to absurd levels, OHKOing Arceus formes that don't resist its moves and 2HKOing most resistant targets with V-create. Heavy-Duty Boots, on the other hand, allows Arceus-Fire to take better advantage of its resistance to common Fairy- and Fire-type attacks. Arceus-Fire has difficulty breaking past Fire-immune foes, most commonly Well-Baked Body Steel-types, so it pairs well with teammates that can handle these targets like Groudon and Headlong Rush Enamorus. Imposter-proofing is done with Well-Baked Body Steel-types or Primordial Sea users. Tera Fire boosts the power of V-create even further, while Tera Grass grants a Ground resistance and a much stronger Solar Beam.

sets.name: No Retreat
sets.description: Simple + No Retreat turns Arceus-Ghost into a threatening setup sweeper that is hard to revenge kill. Spooky Plate + Judgment allows Arceus-Ghost to Imposter-proof itself and block Knock Off's item removal. Triple Arrows provides perfect neutral coverage with Spooky Plate Judgment and keeps Arceus-Ghost Imposter-proof. The secondary effects also allow Arceus-Ghost to break past walls like Yveltal and Ice Scales Pokemon. Low Kick has more PP and consistently does more damage than Triple Arrows, but it can't be used to luck past non-Covert Cloak foes, and Mega Audino walls Low Kick variants. Jungle Healing removes crippling status conditions while also acting as a form of recovery to mitigate chip damage. Its lower healing compared to alternatives like Strength Sap is valuable for breaking through Imposter users, although, in a pinch, these can use No Retreat and attempt to stall Judgment. Arceus-Ghost highly appreciates Knock Off users like RegenVest Pokemon to help remove Imposter Chansey's Eviolite, weaken opposing RegenVest Pokemon, and remove Covert Cloaks for Triple Arrows; in return, Arceus-Ghost acts as a decent Knock Off and status absorber. Arceus-Ghost can struggle against Pokemon like Fur Coat Yveltal and Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy, so offensive teammates like Mega Diancie and Teravolt Kartana pair well with it.

sets.name: Ice Scales
sets.description: Ice Scales Arceus-Ground is a good special wall that can reliably tank hits from most special attackers in the tier. Strength Sap can slow down most physical Pokemon. Tidy Up provides unblockable entry hazard removal and boosts Arceus-Ground's offensive capabilities, allowing it to clean late-game provided roadblocks like Ho-Oh and Celesteela have been removed. Toxic bypasses Covert Cloak, extering pressure on defensive Pokemon like opposing Arceus formes. Mega Mewtwo X pairs excellently with Arceus-Ground, as Arceus-Ground can deal with Mega Diancie, while, in return, Mega Mewtwo X can help Arceus-Ground deal with Water-types such as Mega Swampert and Mega Slowbro by using Chloroblast. Arceus-Ground pairs well with RegenVest Yveltal and Ice Scales Dialga-O, as these provide a good option against Chloroblast users and Palkia-O, respectively. Arceus-Ground can struggle against the likes of Kyurem-B because of the latter's Glacial lance, so it pairs well with bulky Water-types like Fur Coat Dondozo and Mega Slowbro which, can help manage the aforementioned Pokemon and bring Arceus-Ground in on their checks with Flip Turn, forcing them out. Arceus-Ground can be Imposter-proofed by the likes of Celesteela and Magic Guard Ho-Oh.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Fur Coat Arceus-Poison's great bulk and typing make it an effective check to Koraidon and Enamorus. Its natural immunity to poison notably inflicted by Mortal Spin and Toxic, which are common countermeasures to setup Arceus formes, also makes it a dangerous Calm Mind sweeper. Icicle Plate Judgment hits numerous threats super effectively, including Koraidon, Groudon, Eternatus, Rayquaza, and Ting-Lu while also hitting both Dialga-O and Corviknight neutrally, preventing them from comfortably blocking Mortal Spin and Toxic. Mortal Spin removes entry hazards and bypasses Magic Bounce, while Toxic bypasses Covert Cloak and exerts more pressure on defensive checks like Ice Scales Arceus formes. Tera Steel retains Arceus-Poison's poison immunity while granting a resistance to Flying-type attacks from Rayquaza. Arceus-Poison is susceptible to Imposter users, as Imposter copies Arceus-Poison's immunity to poison, so a threatening Imposter-proof like Flare Boost Flutter Mane is recommended. Groudon is a physical attacker that Arceus-Poison cannot handle, so it appreciates a teammate like Corviknight or a Jungle Healing Pokemon such as Dondozo. Offensive wallbreakers like Koraidon and Enamorus can be Imposter-proofed by Arceus-Poison and offer high immediate power to compensate for Arceus-Poison's low initial power.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Fur Coat Arceus-Water is a strong defensive wall thanks to its great typing and bulk. Scald reliably spreads burns, helping spread chip damage and neutralize physical attackers. Knock Off removes items like Covert Cloak and Leftovers, making its burns easier to spread and more damaging, and also boosts Arceus-Water's own survivability by removing Choice Band; alternatively, Spikes can force passive damage on foes, which offensive teammates can exploit. Flip Turn allows Arceus-Water to bring in dangerous offensive teammates against Scald switch-ins like Dondozo and Giratina. Covert Cloak allows Arceus-Water to stop status from moves like Magical Torque, Nuzzle, and Scald, while Leftovers boosts its longevity. Arceus-Water's best fit is on balance teams, which appreciate a reliable physcial wall and a pivot. Offensive teammates, like Koraidon and Flutter Mane, are recommended as they enjoy the safe pivoting Arceus-Water provides and the chip damage it inflicts. Arceus-Water is best Improofed by itself, as Knock Off sets can threaten Imposter users with item removal and Scald burns.

sets.name: Mixed
sets.description: Mixed Mega Diancie is a powerful wallbreaker that also provides utility with its strong priority. Life Orb-boosted Pixilate Extreme Speed OHKOes fast threats like Pheromosa, Palkia-O, and Mega Mewtwo X, with only the latter requiring slight chip damage to do so. V-create is the strongest coverage option against Steel-types, OHKOing Solgaleo, Ferrothorn, and Mega Scizor, as well as KOing Mega Steelix that has switched into Boomburst. Precipice Blades is a weaker alternative that misses KOs on the aforementioned but instead hits Fire-types like Arceus-Fire and Victini. Rapid Spin can provide entry hazard removal in a pinch. Pain Split is an effective recovery move due to Mega Diancie's low HP to offset Life Orb recoil, and it's also ineffective for Imposter users. Strength Sap is an alternative that is more reliable, but it can be more annoying to Imposter-proof. Mega Diancie has difficulties bypassing certain walls like Ho-Oh and Fur Coat Arceus-Poison, so offensive partners like mixed Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Garchomp synergize well. Knock Off support also is helpful for removing Assault Vest from Pokemon like Primal Kyogre and Mega Steelix to make Boomburst more spammable, and it's also useful against Heavy-Duty Boots Ho-Oh. Mega Diancie can be Imposter-proofed by Ho-Oh, Ice Scales Arceus formes, and, depending on the coverage option, Steel-types not weak to Ground or Fire.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Choice Specs Mega Diancie is a threatening wallbreaker thanks to a strong and fast Pixilate-boosted Boomburst, which can rip through anything that doesn't resist it or have Ice Scales or Assault Vest. Revelation Dance chunks Fire-types like Ho-Oh and Arceus-Fire for heavy damage, invalidating both as checks. Volt Switch helps keep momentum against bulky checks like Primal Kyogre and Arceus-Fairy, giving opportunities to teammates to help whittle them down. The last move is fairly customizable; Extreme Speed picks off faster threats like Pheromosa and weakened Mega Mewtwo X and Palkia-O, while the other moves target Poison- and Steel-types like Arceus-Poison and Mega Steelix. Mega Diancie's main drawback is that it often lacks the raw power to beat special walls like Ice Scales Arceus formes, so supporting allies like Eternatus help wear them down over time. Mega Steelix is a severe thorn in Mega Diancie's side, as it can reliably scout the move it locks into, denies Volt Switch, and can pivot in an offensive teammate; as such, Knock Off support is recommended, as Mega Steelix is 2HKOed by Boomburst without its Assault Vest. Imposter-proof Mega Diancie with Mega Steelix, Chansey, or Fur Coat Arceus-Poison, depending on its last move.

sets.name: Ice Scales
sets.description: Ice Scales Zacian is an effective special wall against prominent special attackers like Palkia-O and Arceus-Ghost. Spirit Break dissuades setup from Arceus formes, Eternatus, and Palkia-O, though Magical Torque is a stronger alternative. While seemingly counter-productive with Spirit Break, Haze is the best option to neuter Nasty Plot Palkia-O and Arceus-Ghost, and it also ensures Zacian beats No Retreat Arceus-Ghost. Spikes provides support for the team and makes progress against Strength Sap users. Spirit Shackle traps Imposter users, preventing them from recovering health for free on Zacian. Toxic punishes most setup special attackers like Calm Mind Arceus formes. Covert Cloak prevents burns from Palkia-O's Steam Eruption and protects against status conditions inflicted by Nuzzle and Mortal Spin. Alternatively, Heavy-Duty Boots and Leftovers help mitigate entry hazard damage and keep Zacian healthy. Ability Shield is useful against Normalize users like Dragapult and Mold Breaker users like Palkia-O. Zacian pairs very well with a secondary specially defensive pivot like RegenVest Ting-Lu or Dialga-O, as they can scout for moves from Choice Specs users while not being chipped down by Volt Switch. In return, Zacian provides a switch-in to strong Dragon-type moves while also checking setup Pokemon like Palkia-O and Nasty Plot Flutter Mane. Imposter-proofs for Spikes variants include Fur Coat Groudon and Arceus-Ground, while Toxic variants can be Imposter-proofed by Arceus-Poison and Corviknight. Tera Steel provides a resistance to Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane's Boomburst while retaining a Dragon resistance, as well as providing a Toxic immunity.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Fur Coat Zacian differentiates itself from other Fur Coat users with its high Speed, outspeeding dangerous physical threats like Koraidon and threatening them with Knock Off or Will-O-Wisp. Spirit Break is a weaker alternative to Magical Torque that offers more PP and a useful secondary effect, preventing Calm Mind Arceus formes and Torch Song Eternatus from freely setting up. Knock Off removes important items like Choice Band and Assault Vest from Pokemon like Groudon and Ting-Lu, respectively, as well as removing Imposter Chansey's Eviolite. Will-O-Wisp neutralizes most physical attackers like Koraidon. Spirit Shackle threatens to trap and eliminate Imposter users and physical threats walled by Zacian. Toxic cripples Imposter users and most Fur Coat users. Heavy-Duty Boots and Leftovers help mitigate entry hazard damage, allowing Zacian to check physical threats more reliably, while Covert Cloak provides protection against status conditions from Nuzzle and Mortal Spin. Zacian can struggle to handle extremely powerful physical wallbreakers like Groudon and Mold Breaker Koraidon by itself, so secondary physical walls like Fur Coat Arceus formes are appreciated as teammates; they can also Imposter-proof Zacian. Despite outspeeding threats like Palkia-O and Flutter Mane, Zacian cannot switch in, so a special wall like Ice Scales Dialga-O or Chansey can help pivot Zacian in. Tera Water grants a resistance to V-create and Gigaton Hammer, the latterof which Koraidon commonly uses to threaten Zacian.

sets.name: Pixilate
sets.description: Pixilate Zacian is a powerful cleaner. Pixilate boosted Population Bomb is an incredibly strong STAB move, 2HKOing defensive behemoths like Fur Coat Dondozo at +2. Coil + Protective Pads and Swords Dance + Wide Lens both increase Population Bomb's power and accuracy, with the former bypassing Rocky Helmet and the latter providing a stronger boost, notably letting Zacian boost past Strength Sap. Rapid Spin with Pixilate provides unblockable entry hazard removal in a pinch, while Precipice Blades targets Fairy-resistant Pokemon like Arceus-Poison and Arceus-Fire. Spirit Shackle is an option with Coil to trap and eliminate Imposter users, which are otherwise problematic. Knock Off users like Ting-Lu and Groudon are mandatory for Wide Lens sets to remove Rocky Helmet. While Zacian can remove hazards with Rapid Spin, hazard setters often carry moves that can heavily cripple it like Nuzzle and Knock Off, making another hazard remover like Tidy Up Groudon or Mortal Spin Ting-Lu a good choice. Groudon notably also pressures Fairy-resistant Pokemon like Arceus-Poison and Arceus-Fire well. Imposter users serve as a strong check to this set, so having a sturdy Imposter-proofing teammate is necessary, with Rocky Helmet + Fur Coat users or Corviknight being good candidates.

sets.name: Mold Breaker
sets.description: Mold Breaker Eternatus is a threatening attacker that takes advantage of teams that heavily rely on Ice Scales to tackle special attackers. Torch Song hits Steel-types like Mega Steelix for good damage and allows Eternatus to boost alongside Calm Mind Arceus formes. Spikes allows Eternatus to take advantage of the switches it forces and notably ensures that it can make immediate progress against foes like RegenVest Primal Kyogre; alternatively, Toxic can wear away at foes without requiring multiple Special Attack boosts and high HP for Dragon Energy, and Sludge Bomb eliminates targets like Arceus-Fairy and Mega Diancie much faster and more reliably than Torch Song. Mold Breaker Eternatus appreciates support from mixed attackers like Mega Diancie and Arceus-Ghost, as these can help pressure one of Eternatus's best checks in RegenVest Primal Kyogre; these both also appreciate Eternatus's strong matchup into specially defensive Fairy-types if using Toxic or Sludge Bomb. Knock Off users are also similarly effective, as removal of Assault Vest puts both Primal Kyogre and Mega Steelix into 2HKO range. Imposter-proof Mold Breaker Eternatus with Imposter Chansey.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Fur Coat Dondozo is a great defensive Pokemon with its high physical bulk and typing, which allows it to wall physical attackers such as Koraidon and Groudon. Spikes supports offensive teammates, while Haze stops foes like Tidy Up Groudon from setting up. Knock Off removes items such as Covert Cloak and Leftovers, and Scald burns provide chip damage on foes. Flip Turn makes it easier to pivot into offensive teammates such as Koraidon, since Taunt, Dark-types, and Magic Bounce don't block it; alternatively, Parting Shot makes the foe easier to handle for Dondozo's teammates, but it's stopped by Taunt and Good as Gold. Heavy-Duty Boots, notably eases Dondozo's pivoting, while Rocky Helmet punishes contact moves such as U-turn and V-create. Covert Cloak protects against secondary effects like confusion from Magical Torque and burns from Scald. Tera Fire allows Dondozo to resist Magical Torque and Grass-type moves from Arceus-Fire, and it maintains Dondozo's resistance to Fire-type moves such as V-create. Dondozo appreciates defensive teammates with typing synergy such as RegenVest Ting-Lu, which helps protect Dondozo from threatening Pokemon such as Eternatus.

sets.name: Prankster
sets.description: Prankster Dondozo with Haze can reliably check physical setup sweepers such as Groudon thanks to its huge physical bulk. Entrainment forces out Pokemon dependent on their abilities, Encore can lock foes into unfavorable moves such as setup moves or V-create, and Glare debilitates fast attackers such as Koraidon and Palkia-O. Parting Shot allows Dondozo to maintain momentum against opposing threats such as Arceus-Ghost with its priority pivoting and attack stat reduction, making it easier for teammates such as Ting-Lu to take hits from them; alternatively, Flip Turn provides a pivoting option unaffected by Taunt, Dark-types, and Magic Bounce. Heavy-Duty Boots, notably eases Dondozo's pivoting, while Covert Cloak protects it from status conditions from moves such as Nuzzle, Mortal Spin, and Magical Torque. Tera Fire improves Dondozo's matchup against Arceus-Fire with Grass-type coverage and lets it resist V-create and Magical Torque, whereas Tera Dark makes Dondozo immune to status moves from other Prankster users and improves its matchup against Ghost- and Dark-types. RegenVest Hisuian Goodra, Ting-Lu, and Fur Coat users synergize with Dondozo, covering threats such as Arceus-Fairy, Groudon, and Palkia-O.

sets.name: Flare Boost
sets.description: Flame Orb + Flare Boost grants Flutter Mane a pseudo-immunity to crippling status like paralysis and poison while granting a power boost that cannot be removed by Knock Off. At +2, Flutter Mane is capable of 2HKOing even Ice Scales Arceus formes with Astral Barrage. Due to Flutter Mane's naturally low HP stat, Pain Split is an effective way to increase its longevity while notably annoying Chansey and being ineffective for Imposter users. Tera Fairy boosts Moonblast's damage while shedding Flutter Mane's Ghost weakness, making it useful against Knock Off and stray Ghost-type moves. Tera Ghost further boosts Astral Barrage, helping Flutter Mane break past walls like Calm Mind Ice Scales Arceus formes, and helps defensively against Dialga-O's Revelation Dance. Tera Steel prevents potential revenge killing from Iron Bundle's Boomburst and Koraidon's Gigaton Hammer, as well as resisting Dialga-O's Revelation Dance. Flutter Mane pairs very well with other special attackers, such as Palkia-O, Eternatus, and setup Arceus formes, that place heavy pressure on opposing special walls like Chansey and Ice Scales Dialga-O. Setup Arceus formes can also inflict Chansey with poison using Toxic or Mortal Spin, greatly increasing Flutter Mane's capability of stalling it out of recovery. Defensive pivots like Ting-Lu can provide entry hazard support, deny momentum from Chansey, and pivot Flutter Mane in safely. Paralysis support from the likes of Ting-Lu can also slow down the troublesome Zacian, which outspeeds and threatens Flutter Mane. Imposter-proof Flutter Mane with a special wall with a relatively low HP stat like Ice Scales Zacian, though your Chansey can also Imposter-proof it at the risk of providing Pain Split healing for the opposing Imposter.

sets.name: Pixilate
sets.description: Pixilate Flutter Mane takes advantage of the lack of sturdy Fairy-resistant special walls to fire off powerful Pixilate-boosted Boombursts. Volt Switch retains momentum, chips checks like Chansey and Ice Scales Zacian, and scouts Terastallization. Pain Split increases Flutter Mane's longevity while chipping Chansey for good damage. Trick is an alternative to cripple special walls like Chansey for teammates. Tera Fairy further boosts Boomburst's damage output, letting it 2HKO Ice Scales Zacian, as well as 2HKOing Ice Scales Dialga-O and Arceus formes after 1 layer of Spikes. Flutter Mane greatly appreciates Knock Off support from teammates like Ting-Lu to remove items like Assault Vest, Heavy-Duty Boots, and Chansey's Eviolite to enhance its offensive potential. Entry hazards and paralysis support from the likes of Ting-Lu and Dialga-O help chip down special walls into 2HKO range and neutralize faster threats like Zacian, respectively. Other special attackers like Palkia-O and Eternatus can capitalize on crippled special walls from Flutter Mane's Trick. Flutter Mane can be easily Imposter-proofed by your own Chansey, but a Ground-type like Ice Scales Arceus-Ground can deny momentum from the Imposter user's Volt Switch.

sets.name: RegenVest
sets.description: RegenVest Ting-Lu is a reliable special wall and a premier momentum generator. Regenerator gives Ting-Lu reliable recovery without conflicting with Assault Vest. Nuzzle discourages dangerous attackers like Palkia-O from switching in. U-turn allows Ting-Lu to safely bring in teammates thanks to its low Speed. Stone Axe forces chip damage on foes, letting offensive teammates wallbreak more easily. Knock Off removes items like Heavy-Duty Boots and Covert Cloak, making Ting-Lu's own utility more effective; it also punishes Imposter users attempting to gain Regenerator. Ting-Lu fits best on balance teams, which appreciate its ability to spread paralysis and safely bring in teammates thanks to its huge bulk. Dangerous wallbreakers like Koraidon and Palkia-O help maximize the effectiveness of U-turn pivoting. Ting-Lu is unable to naturally check Palkia-O and Fairy-types like Flutter Mane, so a teammate that helps shore up this weakness, such as Arceus-Grass or Hisuian Goodra, is appreciated. Tera Fairy provides an immunity to Dragon, allowing Ting-Lu to block Dragon Energy from Palkia-O and Glaive Rush from Koraidon; alternatively, Tera Grass provides a Water resistance, covering for Palkia-O's Water Spout.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Fur Coat Miraidon is an excellent support Pokemon due to its favorable typing and high Speed, crucially outspeeding threats like Mega Mewtwo X and Kartana to neutralize them with Strength Sap. Thunder Cage provides a consistent, high PP STAB move that is effective at wearing down checks such Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy. Passive damaging moves synergize well with Thunder Cage; Mortal Spin provides entry hazard removal in a pinch and is effective against Imposter users, while Leech Seed and Salt Cure are alternate options that also prevent Imposter users from removing the partial trapping of Thunder Cage. Calm Mind allows Miraidon to act as a bulky setup sweeper, with Lava Plume pressuring checks like Mega Steelix and Ferrothorn, while Judgment hits Dragon-types like opposing Miraidon; however, Calm Mind should never be used with Salt Cure. Steel-types synergize well defensively with Miraidon by switching into threatening wallbreakers like Mega Diancie and Kyurem-B and can also block Imposter users' Mortal Spin. Ho-Oh checks Mega Diancie, provides a Ground-immunity, and appreciates Miraidon as an Imposter-proofer. Other strong physical wallbreakers like Kartana and Mega Blaziken can also be Imposter-proofed by Miraidon.
